ActorFRESCO.name: ActorFRESCO

key_parameters.number_of_iterations: Number of outer and inner iterations for solver convergence
key_parameters.nR: Grid resolution along major radius R
key_parameters.nZ: Grid resolution along vertical direction Z
key_parameters.active_x_points: Indices of active X-points in the equilibrium solver
key_parameters.fixed_grid: Grid type for fixing pressure and current profiles (:psi_norm or :rho_tor_norm)

ActorFRESCO.description: Fixed boundary equilibrium solver that computes plasma equilibrium using the FRESCO code
usage_notes: Requires wall information from dd.wall or can construct from pf_active coils
Uses Green's function tables that can be reused across iterations
Solver uses Picard iterations with configurable relaxation
Automatically updates PF coil currents after solving
Sets equilibrium as free boundary type after solving

ActorPowerNeeds.name: ActorPowerNeeds
ActorPowerNeeds.physics_domain: Balance of plant electrical power consumption

key_parameters.model: Power plant electrical needs model - options: :thermal_power_fraction, :EU_DEMO, :FUSE
key_parameters.thermal_power_fraction: Fraction of gross electrical power for plant operation (when model=:thermal_power_fraction)

ActorPowerNeeds.description: Power needs actor that calculates the electrical power required to operate various plant subsystems including heating/current drive, cryostat, tritium handling, and PF coils
usage_notes: Supports three models: thermal_power_fraction (simple fraction), EU_DEMO (fixed subdivided values), and FUSE (self-consistent subsystem calculations)
Calculates power needs for HCD systems (NBI, EC, IC, LH) based on launcher power and efficiency
EU_DEMO model uses fixed values: cryostat=30MW, tritium_handling=15MW, pf_active=0MW
Stores all electrical power consumption data in balance_of_plant.power_electric_plant_operation

ActorPedestal.name: ActorPedestal
ActorPedestal.physics_domain: Edge plasma physics and pedestal modeling

key_parameters.rho_ped: Defines rho at which the pedestal region starts
key_parameters.mode_transitions: Times at which plasma transitions between L and H modes
key_parameters.tau_n: Edge density LH transition tanh evolution time
key_parameters.rho_nml: Defines rho at which the no man's land region starts
key_parameters.model: Pressure edge model selection (EPED, WPED, dynamic, analytic, replay, none)
key_parameters.density_match: Matching density based on ne_ped or line averaged density
key_parameters.tau_t: Edge temperature LH transition tanh evolution time
key_parameters.T_ratio_pedestal: Ratio of ion to electron temperatures

ActorPedestal.description: Evaluates the pedestal boundary condition (height and width) for plasma edge profiles, handling L-H mode transitions and various pedestal models
usage_notes: Supports multiple pedestal models including EPED, WPED, and analytic approaches
Handles L-H and H-L mode transitions with configurable time constants
Dynamic model requires ne_from = :pulse_schedule
Pedestal values are defined at rho=0.9 throughout FUSE
EPED and WPED models only operate on temperature profiles
Enforces quasi-neutrality after pedestal calculations

ActorPFdesign.name: ActorPFdesign
ActorPFdesign.physics_domain: Magnetic field control and coil design

key_parameters.symmetric: Force PF coils location to be up-down symmetric
key_parameters.reset_rails: Reset PF coils rails before optimization
key_parameters.update_equilibrium: Overwrite target equilibrium with the one that the coils can actually make

ActorPFdesign.description: Optimizes poloidal field (PF) coil locations and currents to achieve a desired plasma equilibrium configuration
usage_notes: Manipulates data in dd.pf_active
Uses least-squares optimization to find coil currents satisfying boundary and flux constraints
Optimal placement mode minimizes coil spacing conflicts and current requirements
Can automatically size PF coils based on current requirements with margin tolerance

ActorPlasmaLimits.name: ActorPlasmaLimits

key_parameters.models: Vector of model symbols to run for checking plasma operational limits
key_parameters.raise_on_breach: Whether to raise an error when operational limits are breached (default: false)

ActorPlasmaLimits.description: Evaluates and enforces plasma operational limits by running multiple limit checking models and reporting breaches
usage_notes: Runs all specified limit models sequentially
Generates reports on passed and failed stability rules
Can either warn or error when limits are breached based on raise_on_breach parameter
Displays percentage of limit threshold reached for each model
Supports customizable limit models through the models parameter

ActorEPEDprofiles.name: ActorEPEDprofiles
ActorEPEDprofiles.physics_domain: Pedestal and core plasma profiles modeling

key_parameters.Te_shaping: Shaping coefficient for the temperature profile
key_parameters.T_ratio_core: Ion to electron temperature ratio in the core
key_parameters.ne_shaping: Shaping coefficient for the density profile
key_parameters.T_ratio_pedestal: Ion to electron temperature ratio in the pedestal

ActorEPEDprofiles.description: Updates pedestal height and width and blends with core profiles defined by shaping factors without changing on-axis values
usage_notes: Runs EPED model to determine pedestal pressure and width
Preserves on-axis values of plasma profiles
Updates both electron and ion temperature and density profiles
Maintains quasi-neutrality by preserving ion-to-electron density ratios
Will error if resulting temperature or density profiles become negative

ActorSawteeth.name: ActorSawteeth
ActorSawteeth.description: Applies sawteeth reconnection to core_sources and core_profiles when q < 1.0 in the plasma core
usage_notes: Finds the last radial position where safety factor q < 1.0
Applies sawteeth source modifications using IMAS.sawteeth_source!
Profile modification (IMAS.sawteeth_profiles!) is currently commented out
Sawteeth events are triggered when q drops below 1.0 in the plasma core

ActorCosting.name: ActorCosting
ActorCosting.physics_domain: Economic and cost analysis for fusion power plants

key_parameters.future_inflation_rate: Predicted average rate of future inflation
key_parameters.plant_lifetime: Lifetime of the plant in years
key_parameters.learning_rate: Learning rate for ReBCO technology production
key_parameters.production_increase: Factor by which production of ReBCO multiplies per year

ActorCosting.description: Estimates the cost of building, operating, and recommissioning the fusion power plant
usage_notes: Supports two costing models: ARIES and Sheffield
Production increase must be >= 0.0
Learning rate must be between 0.0 and 1.0
Uses Measurement types for uncertainty quantification
Stores all costing data in dd.costing structure

ActorStresses.name: ActorStresses
ActorStresses.physics_domain: Structural mechanics and stress analysis for tokamak center stack components

key_parameters.do_plot: Whether to display stress plots after calculation
key_parameters.n_points: Number of radial grid points for stress calculations

ActorStresses.description: Estimates mechanical stresses on the center stack (TF coils, OH coils, and optional center plug) using 1D solid mechanics equations
usage_notes: Uses Leuer 1D solid mechanics equations based on derivations in Engineering Physics Note EPNjal17dec17_gasc_pt5_tf_oh_plug_buck
Supports multiple coil configurations: free standing OH and TF, bucked OH-TF, bucked plug-OH-TF, bucked plug-TF with OH freestanding
Calculates radial, hoop, axial, and Von Mises stresses for TF, OH, and plug components
Stores worst-case stress scenarios when multiple configurations are evaluated
TF coil can be modeled with a steel nose section that provides bucked support without carrying current

ActorCostingSheffield.name: ActorCostingSheffield
ActorCostingSheffield.physics_domain: Economic analysis and cost estimation for fusion power plants

key_parameters.capitalize_divertor: Include cost of 1st divertor in direct capital cost
key_parameters.blanket_fluence_lifetime: Blanket fluence over its lifetime in MW*yr/m²
key_parameters.capitalize_blanket: Include cost of 1st blanket in direct capital cost
key_parameters.divertor_fluence_lifetime: Divertor fluence over its lifetime in MW*yr/m²

ActorCostingSheffield.description: Estimates fusion power plant costing based on Sheffield and Milora, FS&T 70 (2016) methodology
usage_notes: Stores all costing data in dd.costing structure
Based on Sheffield and Milora, FS&T 70 (2016) methodology
Calculates direct capital costs for fusion island and facility components
Computes yearly fuel costs including blanket and divertor replacement
Determines operations and maintenance costs
Calculates levelized cost of electricity (LCOE)
Uses dollar adjustment for inflation calculations
Assumes 20% of first wall is covered by divertor

ActorCHEASE.name: ActorCHEASE

key_parameters.clear_workdir: Clean the temporary workdir for CHEASE
key_parameters.free_boundary: Convert fixed boundary equilibrium to free boundary one
key_parameters.rescale_eq_to_ip: Scale equilibrium to match plasma current Ip

ActorCHEASE.description: Runs the CHEASE fixed boundary equilibrium solver to compute MHD equilibrium from pressure and current profiles
usage_notes: Requires boundary, pressure and current density profiles as inputs
Can convert fixed boundary equilibrium to free boundary using VacuumFields
Applies curvature limiting to boundary points before processing
Outputs data in COCOS 11 convention from CHEASE's COCOS 1
Updates PF coil currents when converting to free boundary

ActorWholeFacility.name: ActorWholeFacility

key_parameters.update_build: Optimize tokamak build (engineering design and optimization)
key_parameters.update_plasma: Run plasma related actors (stationary plasma solution)

ActorWholeFacility.description: Compound actor that orchestrates all physics, engineering and costing actors needed to model a complete fusion facility, from plasma physics to balance of plant and costing
usage_notes: This is the top-level compound actor for integrated facility modeling
Coordinates the execution order of all sub-actors to ensure self-consistency
Will skip engineering/costing actors if build is missing
ActorPFdesign is called twice when update_build is true to ensure consistency between build and equilibrium
Stores all results directly in the IMAS dd structure

ActorNoOperation.name: ActorNoOperation

key_parameters._name: Symbol identifier for the actor instance

ActorNoOperation.description: A no-operation actor that doesn't perform any actions. Useful as a placeholder to turn off models without breaking workflows.
usage_notes: This actor doesn't perform any operations in its step or finalize methods
Can be used as a placeholder when you want to disable certain models without removing them from the workflow
Implements the standard actor interface but with empty step and finalize implementations

ActorCostingARIES.name: ActorCostingARIES
ActorCostingARIES.physics_domain: Economic analysis and cost estimation for fusion power plants

key_parameters.escalation_fraction: Yearly escalation fraction based on risk (default: 0.05±0.01)
key_parameters.building_volume: Volume of the tokamak building in m³ (default: 140e3±14e3)
key_parameters.land_space: Plant site space required in acres (default: 1000±100)
key_parameters.interest_rate: Annual interest rate fraction of direct capital cost (default: 0.05±0.01)
key_parameters.indirect_cost_rate: Indirect cost for construction, equipment, services (default: 0.4±0.01)
key_parameters.blanket_lifetime: Lifetime of the blanket in years (default: 7.0±1.0)

ActorCostingARIES.description: Estimates fusion plant costing based on ARIES cost account documentation, covering capital costs, operations, and decommissioning
usage_notes: Based on ARIES cost account documentation (UCSD-CER-13-01.pdf)
Stores all costing data in dd.costing structure
Calculates levelized cost of electricity (LCOE)
Includes dollar adjustment for inflation using DollarAdjust
Sorts systems/subsystems by cost in descending order during finalization
Handles multiple heating systems: EC, IC, LH, and NBI
Avoids double counting of HFS/LFS layers and OH coils

ActorCoreRadHeatFlux.name: ActorCoreRadHeatFlux
ActorCoreRadHeatFlux.physics_domain: Plasma radiation transport and wall heat loading

key_parameters.levels: Number of SOL levels (int) or psi levels to build SOL (vector)
key_parameters.step: Step size for discretization of default wall mesh in meters (default: 0.1)
key_parameters.N: Number of launched photons for Monte Carlo simulation (default: 100000)
key_parameters.r: Vector of radial positions at outer midplane in meters
key_parameters.q: Vector of parallel power density at outer midplane in W/m^2
key_parameters.merge_wall: Whether to merge dd.wall in mesh for heat flux calculation

ActorCoreRadHeatFlux.description: Computes the heat flux on the wall due to core plasma radiation using Monte Carlo photon transport
usage_notes: Uses Monte Carlo photon transport to calculate core radiation heat flux on plasma-facing components
Requires equilibrium and core profiles data to compute radiation sources
Creates wall mesh with SOL intersections for heat flux calculation
Negative sign convention used for energy loss from core sources
Wall heat flux stored in actor.wall_heat_flux field after computation

ActorPassiveStructures.name: ActorPassiveStructures
ActorPassiveStructures.physics_domain: Passive conducting structures and vertical stability

key_parameters.do_plot: Whether to plot the pf_passive structures after generation

ActorPassiveStructures.description: Populates pf_passive IDS based on the vacuum vessel layer(s), creating passive conducting structures for MHD stability calculations
usage_notes: Requires vacuum vessel layers to be defined in build.layer
Warning issued if no vessel found - vertical stability metrics cannot be computed
Resistivity is taken from the outermost build layer material
Does not account for toroidal breaks, heterogeneous materials, or water-cooled vacuum vessels
Falls back to steel material properties if electrical conductivity is missing
Creates quadrilateral passive conducting loops between vessel layers

ActorLFSsizing.name: ActorLFSsizing
ActorLFSsizing.physics_domain: Tokamak radial build and structural design

key_parameters.pol_modularity: Number of poloidal modules of each toroidal blanket sector (1 or 2)
key_parameters.tor_modularity: Number of toroidal modules of blanket normalized to number of TF coils
key_parameters.maintenance: Scheme for installation/removal of in-vessel components (vertical, horizontal, or none)

ActorLFSsizing.description: Resizes the Low Field Side of the tokamak radial build by adjusting the location of the outer TF leg based on ripple requirements and maintenance port constraints
usage_notes: Manipulates radial build information in dd.build.layer
Calculates TF leg radius based on ripple requirements
Accounts for vacuum port geometry when maintenance scheme is specified
Resizes vacuum gap between vessel and plasma to accommodate TF coil position changes
tor_modularity must be greater than 0
pol_modularity must be either 1 or 2

ActorCXbuild.name: ActorCXbuild
ActorCXbuild.physics_domain: Tokamak structural engineering and build geometry

key_parameters.rebuild_wall: Rebuild wall based on equilibrium, even if dd.wall is already filled
key_parameters.layers_aware_of_pf_coils: Build layers are aware of pf_active coils
key_parameters.divertor_lfs_size_fraction: Divertor size on the low-field-side as fraction of plasma minor radius
key_parameters.do_plot: Enable plotting of the build cross-section
key_parameters.n_points: Number of points used for cross-sectional outlines
key_parameters.divertor_hfs_size_fraction: Divertor size on the high-field-side as fraction of plasma minor radius

ActorCXbuild.description: Generates the 2D cross section of the tokamak build including walls, divertors, blankets, and maintenance ports
usage_notes: Manipulates data in dd.build
Generates first wall information from equilibrium if missing
Creates 2D cross-sections for all build layers
Identifies divertor regions and strike points
Generates blanket and maintenance port structures
Requires equilibrium data to properly generate build geometry

ActorNeutronics.name: ActorNeutronics

key_parameters.N: Number of neutron particles to simulate for Monte Carlo calculation (default: 100000)
key_parameters.do_plot: Boolean flag to enable/disable plotting of neutron flux results

ActorNeutronics.description: Estimates neutron wall loading from fusion reactions and calculates neutron flux distribution on the first wall
usage_notes: Calculates neutron flux from D-T and D-D fusion reactions
Uses Monte Carlo particle tracking with N particles
Automatically renormalizes wall loading to match total fusion neutron power
Resamples wall geometry with 0.1m step size for flux calculation
Stores results in dd.neutronics data structure

ActorAnalyticPedestal.name: ActorAnalyticPedestal
ActorAnalyticPedestal.physics_domain: Pedestal physics and edge transport barriers

key_parameters.rho_ped: Rho at which pedestal region starts
key_parameters.T_ratio_pedestal: Ratio of ion to electron temperatures
key_parameters.ped_factor: Pedestal height multiplier (width scaled by sqrt of factor)
key_parameters.rho_nml: Rho at which no man's land region starts

ActorAnalyticPedestal.description: Evaluates the pedestal boundary condition (height and width) using analytic models for tokamak pedestals
usage_notes: Pedestal density throughout FUSE is defined at rho=0.9
Supports three models: TE_MAST (w_ped~beta_p^0.5), TE_NSTX (w_ped~beta_p^1.0), and hiped_MASTU
Width definition uses EPED convention (half width)
Automatically converts between ne_ped09 and ne_ped using tanh width factor
Te_sep must be greater than 0
ped_factor must be greater than 0

ActorCoreTransport.name: ActorCoreTransport

key_parameters.model: Transport actor model to run - options are :FluxMatcher, :EPEDProfiles, :replay, or :none

ActorCoreTransport.description: Provides a common interface to run multiple core transport actors including FluxMatcher, EPEDProfiles, and replay modes
usage_notes: Acts as a wrapper to select and run different core transport models
Default model is FluxMatcher
Replay mode blends core profiles from a replay data source with edge profiles
Uses blend_core_edge method to connect core and edge regions
Scales ion densities to match target Zeff

ActorSimpleEC.name: ActorSimpleEC
ActorSimpleEC.physics_domain: Electron cyclotron heating and current drive

key_parameters.rho_0: Desired radial location of the deposition profile (default=0.5)
key_parameters.width: Desired width of the deposition profile (default=0.025)
key_parameters.ηcd_scale: Scaling factor for nominal current drive efficiency (default=1.0)

ActorSimpleEC.description: Estimates electron cyclotron (EC) electron energy deposition and current drive using a gaussian profile approximation
usage_notes: Current drive efficiency based on GASC model from G. Tonon 'Current Drive Efficiency Requirements for an Attractive Steady-State Reactor'
Performs vacuum ray tracing to determine EC wave trajectory
Automatically estimates operating frequency and resonance mode if not provided
Can automatically determine launch location from wall geometry
Warns if ECH beam does not intersect resonance layer and sets power to zero

ActorParticleHeatFlux.name: ActorParticleHeatFlux
ActorParticleHeatFlux.physics_domain: Plasma-wall interaction and scrape-off layer physics

key_parameters.levels: Number of SOL levels (Int) or specific psi levels (Vector) to build SOL
key_parameters.step: Discretization step for default wall mesh in meters
key_parameters.r: Vector of radial positions at outer midplane in meters
key_parameters.q: Vector of parallel power density at outer midplane in W/m²
key_parameters.do_plot: Enable plotting of heat flux results
key_parameters.merge_wall: Whether to merge dd.wall in mesh for heat flux calculation

ActorParticleHeatFlux.description: Computes the heat flux on the wall due to charged particles, including both perpendicular and parallel components to the magnetic field
usage_notes: Computes both perpendicular (q_part) and parallel (q_parallel) heat flux components
Uses SOL field lines to map power from outer midplane to wall
Wall mesh generation shared with ActorCoreRadHeatFlux for consistency
Results stored in actor.wall_heat_flux as WallHeatFlux structure
Plotting displays 1D heat flux profile and 2D SOL visualization when enabled

ActorAnalyticTurbulence.name: ActorAnalyticTurbulence

key_parameters.χeGB_coefficient: Coefficient of gyro-Bohm component in electron thermal diffusivity
key_parameters.αBgB: Scale factor for BgB transport model
key_parameters.rho_transport: Normalized toroidal flux coordinate values for flux calculations
key_parameters.χeB_coefficient: Coefficient of Bohm component in electron thermal diffusivity
key_parameters.χiGB_coefficient: Coefficient of gyro-Bohm component in ion thermal diffusivity
key_parameters.χiB_coefficient: Coefficient of Bohm component in ion thermal diffusivity

ActorAnalyticTurbulence.description: Evaluates analytic turbulence models for plasma transport, supporting GyroBohm and BgB (Bohm-gyroBohm) models
usage_notes: Supports two analytic models: GyroBohm (simplified) and BgB (Bohm-gyroBohm mixing)
BgB model combines Bohm and gyro-Bohm scaling for electron and ion transport
Transport coefficients χe and χi are computed as weighted sums of Bohm and gyro-Bohm components
Results are written to core_transport.model as anomalous transport fluxes

ActorQLGYRO.name: ActorQLGYRO
ActorQLGYRO.physics_domain: Turbulent transport and gyrokinetic flux predictions

key_parameters.lump_ions: Lump fuel species (D,T) and impurities together (default: true)
key_parameters.cpu_per_ky: Number of CPUs per ky mode (default: 1)
key_parameters.rho_transport: Normalized rho_tor values for flux computation (default: 0.25:0.1:0.85)
key_parameters.max_time: Maximum simulation time in a/cs units (default: 100.0)

ActorQLGYRO.description: Evaluates QLGYRO predicted turbulence using quasilinear gyrokinetic transport modeling
usage_notes: Uses QLGYRO quasilinear model to predict turbulent transport fluxes
Requires GACODE interface for flux calculations
Supports parallel execution with configurable CPUs per ky mode
n_field must be 1, 2, or 3 for different electromagnetic field models
Results written to core_transport.model as anomalous transport

ActorThermalPlant.name: ActorThermalPlant
ActorThermalPlant.physics_domain: Thermal power conversion and balance of plant systems

key_parameters.fixed_plant_efficiency: Overall thermal cycle efficiency when using fixed efficiency model (0.0-1.0)

ActorThermalPlant.description: Manages thermal power plant operations, calculating plant efficiency and electric power generation from various heat loads using different modeling approaches
usage_notes: Requires blanket heat load to function - will warn and return empty if breeder_heat_load is zero
Supports three modeling approaches: fixed efficiency, surrogate model via BalanceOfPlantSurrogate, or detailed network model via ThermalSystemModels extension
ThermalSystemModels extension must be loaded for network model option
Surrogate model uses power cycle type from IMAS data to select appropriate surrogate function

ActorSimpleNB.name: ActorSimpleNB
ActorSimpleNB.physics_domain: Neutral beam injection heating and current drive

key_parameters.smoothing_width: Width of the deposition profile (default: 0.12, must be > 0.0)
key_parameters.banana_shift_fraction: Shift factor for banana orbit effects (default: 0.5, must be >= 0.0)

ActorSimpleNB.description: Calculates NBI (Neutral Beam Injection) ion/electron energy deposition, particle source, rotation and current drive source with a pencil beam model
usage_notes: Uses a pencil beam model for NBI trajectory calculation
Calculates beam deposition including electron and ion heating components
Computes NBI-driven current including direct and bootstrap components
Accounts for banana orbit effects in deposition profile
Saves beam trajectory information to waves.coherent_wave structure
Handles multiple beam energy components and beamlet groups

ActorFluxCalculator.name: ActorFluxCalculator
ActorFluxCalculator.physics_domain: Plasma transport physics including turbulent and neoclassical transport

key_parameters.neoclassical_model: Neoclassical transport model: neoclassical or none
key_parameters.rho_transport: Normalized radial coordinate grid for transport calculations (default 0.25:0.1:0.85)
key_parameters.turbulence_model: Turbulence model selection: TGLF, QLGYRO, analytic, or none

ActorFluxCalculator.description: Provides a common interface to run multiple transport model actors for calculating turbulent and neoclassical fluxes
usage_notes: Orchestrates turbulent and neoclassical transport calculations
Turbulence model can be TGLF, QLGYRO, analytic, or disabled
Neoclassical transport can be included or disabled
Both turbulent and neoclassical actors share the same rho_transport grid

ActorHFSsizing.name: ActorHFSsizing
ActorHFSsizing.physics_domain: Tokamak center stack engineering and optimization

key_parameters.error_on_technology: Error if build stresses and current limits are not met
key_parameters.error_on_performance: Error if requested Bt and flattop duration are not met
key_parameters.verbose: Enable detailed output of optimization results
key_parameters.do_plot: Enable plotting of build and stress results

ActorHFSsizing.description: Resizes the High Field Side of the tokamak radial build, optimizing the center stack (plug, OH, and TF) while accounting for stresses, superconductor critical currents, flux swing, and field requirements
usage_notes: Uses metaheuristic optimization (ECA algorithm) to find optimal HFS configuration
Automatically adjusts TF coil thickness, OH coil thickness, and steel fractions
Respects coil current density margins and stress margins from requirements
Can handle both bucked and unbucked center stack configurations
Manipulates radial build information in dd.build.layer

ActorStationaryPlasma.name: ActorStationaryPlasma
ActorStationaryPlasma.physics_domain: Integrated plasma modeling combining transport, equilibrium, current drive, and pedestal physics

key_parameters.convergence_error: Convergence error threshold for relative change in current and pressure profiles (default: 0.05)

ActorStationaryPlasma.description: Compound actor that iteratively runs multiple physics actors to find a self-consistent stationary plasma solution through transport-equilibrium iterations
usage_notes: Iterates until convergence or max_iterations is reached
Minimum 2 iterations to ensure consistency between equilibrium and profiles
Convergence measured by relative change in j_tor and pressure profiles
Automatically handles grid updates from latest equilibrium
Sets infinite time step for time-dependent actors (QED, FluxMatcher) for stationary solution

ActorHCD.name: ActorHCD

key_parameters.lh_model: LH source actor to run (LHsimple, replay, none)
key_parameters.pellet_model: Pellet source actor to run (PLsimple, replay, none)
key_parameters.ic_model: IC source actor to run (ICsimple, replay, none)
key_parameters.ec_model: EC source actor to run (ECsimple, TORBEAM, replay, none)
key_parameters.nb_model: NB source actor to run (NBsimple, RABBIT, replay, none)
key_parameters.neutral_model: Neutral gas fueling actor to run (NEUCG, replay, none)

ActorHCD.description: Provides a common interface to run all heating and current drive (HCD) actors including EC, IC, LH, NB, pellet injection, and neutral gas fueling
usage_notes: This compound actor orchestrates all heating and current drive systems
Each HCD subsystem can be configured to use different models or replay mode
Neutral actor must run last as it depends on tau_e_thermal calculation from other HCD sources
Automatically calls IMAS.sources! to ensure sources are consistent after execution
Validates consistency between pulse_schedule and hardware configuration for each system
EC launcher hardware details are automatically filled if missing

ActorQED.name: ActorQED

key_parameters.solve_for: Solve for specified Ip or Vloop
key_parameters.qmin_desired: Keep minimum q-profile magnitude above this value
key_parameters.Δt: Time step for evolution (Inf for steady state)
key_parameters.Nt: Number of time steps during evolution

ActorQED.description: Evolves plasma current using the QED current diffusion solver
usage_notes: Actor operates at dd.global_time - time advance must be done externally
Must call IMAS.new_timeslice!(dd, dd.global_time + Δt) and dd.global_time += Δt before calling actor
Uses QED solver for current diffusion with sawtooth effects
Can solve for either specified plasma current (Ip) or loop voltage (Vloop)
Implements q-profile flattening to maintain qmin_desired constraint

ActorDynamicPlasma.name: ActorDynamicPlasma

key_parameters.ip_controller: Use controller to adjust v_loop to match desired Ip
key_parameters.evolve_hcd: Enable/disable heating and current drive evolution
key_parameters.Nt: Number of time steps during evolution

ActorDynamicPlasma.description: Compound actor that evolves plasma state in time through coupled physics simulations including transport, pedestal, heating/current drive, equilibrium, and active feedback control
usage_notes: Uses alternating half-step scheme with different physics updated in each phase
Phase 1 updates: j_ohmic evolution and HCD sources
Phase 2 updates: pedestal and transport with time derivative sources
Equilibrium, sawteeth, and PF active are updated every half step
Supports IP controller mode for feedback control of plasma current
Automatically manages time slicing and retiming of IMAS data structures
Progress monitoring available with verbose flag
Includes comprehensive plasma overview plotting capability

ActorPFactive.name: ActorPFactive
ActorPFactive.physics_domain: Magnetic field control and plasma shaping

key_parameters.strike_points_weight: Weight for strike-point constraints in optimization (default: 0.1)
key_parameters.green_model: Model for coil Green function calculations (default: quad)
key_parameters.x_points_weight: Weight for x-point constraints in optimization (default: 0.1)
key_parameters.update_equilibrium: Whether to overwrite target equilibrium with achievable one
key_parameters.λ_regularize: Regularization parameter for coil current optimization

ActorPFactive.description: Optimizes poloidal field coil currents to match target equilibrium boundary shape and control points using least-squares optimization
usage_notes: Organizes coils into fixed (position and current), pinned (fixed position, optimized current), and optim (both position and current optimized) categories
Uses VacuumFields.jl for magnetic field calculations
Automatically determines optimal regularization parameter if not specified
Can handle both plasma equilibria and field-null configurations
Updates equilibrium psi map based on achievable coil currents when update_equilibrium=true

ActorNeoclassical.name: ActorNeoclassical

key_parameters.model: Neoclassical model to run (changhinton, neo, or hirshmansigmar)
key_parameters.rho_transport: rho_tor_norm values to compute neoclassical fluxes on

ActorNeoclassical.description: Evaluates neoclassical transport fluxes using different models (Chang-Hinton, NEO, or Hirshman-Sigmar)
usage_notes: Default model is hirshmansigmar
Chang-Hinton model only provides ion energy flux
NEO model provides full set of fluxes including momentum
Hirshman-Sigmar model provides energy and particle fluxes but not momentum
Evaluates fluxes on specified rho_tor_norm gridpoints

ActorFluxSwing.name: ActorFluxSwing
ActorFluxSwing.physics_domain: Magnetic flux management and ohmic heating system design

key_parameters.operate_oh_at_j_crit: If true, OH operates at current limit with j_margin. If false, evaluates current needed for required flattop duration

ActorFluxSwing.description: Evaluates OH (ohmic heating) coil flux swing requirements and constraints for tokamak operation, calculating rampup flux, flattop duration, and coil current limits
usage_notes: Stores data in dd.build.flux_swing, dd.build.tf, and dd.build.oh
OH flux consumption based on Ejima coefficient for rampup estimate
Accounts for vertical field contribution from PF coils
Can operate in two modes: maximize flattop duration at current limit or achieve required flattop duration

ActorWPED.name: ActorWPED

key_parameters.ped_to_core_fraction: Ratio of edge (ρ=0.9) to core stored energy (0.05 for L-mode, 0.3 for negative triangularity plasmas)
key_parameters.rho_ped: Normalized radius defining where the pedestal region starts
key_parameters.rho_nml: Normalized radius defining where the no-man's land region starts
key_parameters.T_ratio_pedestal: Ratio of ion to electron temperatures in the pedestal
key_parameters.Te_sep: Electron temperature at the separatrix (default 80 eV)

ActorWPED.description: Adjusts edge temperature profiles to match a specified ratio of edge to core stored energy, used for pedestal physics modeling
usage_notes: Optimizes temperature profiles to achieve target edge-to-core energy ratio
Uses boundary conditions and exponential scaling to blend temperature profiles
Preserves original profile shape while adjusting edge gradients
If ped_to_core_fraction is missing, maintains original ratio

ActorSimplePL.name: ActorSimplePL

key_parameters.rho_0: Desired radial location of the deposition profile (normalized radius)
key_parameters.frequency: Pellet injection frequency from pulse schedule
key_parameters.width: Desired width of the deposition profile
key_parameters.size: Pellet dimensions based on shape type

ActorSimplePL.description: Estimates and models pellet particle deposition in the plasma core, calculating the spatial distribution of particles from pellet injection
usage_notes: Supports multiple pellet launchers through actuator array
Calculates pellet density based on material type (DT, D, T, C, Ne)
Uses beta function for spatial deposition profile shaping
Reads data from pellet_launchers and pulse_schedule, stores results in core_sources

ActorVerticalStability.name: ActorVerticalStability

key_parameters.model: Turn on/off model of vertical stability calculations
key_parameters.do_plot: Enable plotting of passive structures considered for vertical stability

ActorVerticalStability.description: Computes vertical stability metrics including stability margin and normalized growth rate for plasma vertical instabilities
usage_notes: Stability margin should be > 0.15 for vertical stability
Normalized growth rate should be < 10 for stability
Requires valid resistance values for both active and passive coils
Active coils must have non-zero current for computation
Uses VacuumFields module for electromagnetic calculations

ActorEquilibrium.name: ActorEquilibrium
ActorEquilibrium.physics_domain: Plasma equilibrium and magnetic field configuration

key_parameters.vacuum_r0_b0_from: Source for vacuum magnetic field parameters
key_parameters.model: Equilibrium solver to use (TEQUILA, FRESCO, EGGO, CHEASE, replay, none)
key_parameters.j_p_from: Source for current density and pressure profiles (equilibrium or core_profiles)
key_parameters.symmetrize: Force up-down symmetry with respect to magnetic axis

ActorEquilibrium.description: Common interface to run different equilibrium actors, managing equilibrium calculations and flux surface computations
usage_notes: Automatically selects and runs appropriate equilibrium solver based on model parameter
Prepares equilibrium data structure before running selected solver
Adds flux surface information after equilibrium calculation
Can symmetrize equilibrium if requested and number of X-points is even
Supports iteration between equilibrium and other actors via latest_equilibrium_grids!

ActorDivertors.name: ActorDivertors
ActorDivertors.physics_domain: Divertor physics and heat flux management

key_parameters.heat_flux_model: Divertor heat flux model selection (lengyel or stangeby)
key_parameters.heat_spread_factor: Heat flux expansion factor in private flux region (≥1.0)
key_parameters.impurities: Vector of impurity species symbols to include in modeling
key_parameters.thermal_power_extraction_efficiency: Fraction of thermal power extracted by coolant vs lost to structures

ActorDivertors.description: Evaluates divertor heat loading and deposited power using boundary plasma models to calculate heat flux distribution on divertor targets
usage_notes: Uses BoundaryPlasmaModels for heat flux calculations
Calculates SOL width using Eich scaling
Splits power equally between upper and lower divertors
Identifies strike points automatically from field line tracing
Supports multiple heat flux models via heat_flux_model parameter

ActorSteadyStateCurrent.name: ActorSteadyStateCurrent
ActorSteadyStateCurrent.physics_domain: Plasma current drive and current profile evolution

key_parameters.allow_floating_plasma_current: Zero loop voltage if non-inductive fraction exceeds 100% of the target Ip
key_parameters.current_relaxation_radius: Radial position (0-1) at which artificial ohmic current profile relaxation starts
key_parameters.ip_from: Source for plasma current target value

ActorSteadyStateCurrent.description: Evolves the ohmic current to steady state using the conductivity from core profiles
usage_notes: The fundamental quantity being solved is j_total in core_profiles.profiles_1d
Can operate with floating plasma current when non-inductive current exceeds target
Supports blended current relaxation based on diffusion time
current_relaxation_radius must be between 0.0 and 1.0

ActorNeutralFueling.name: ActorNeutralFueling

key_parameters.τp_over_τe: Particle confinement time as fraction of energy confinement time (default: 0.5)

ActorNeutralFueling.description: Estimates neutral fueling deposition from the wall based on the Burrell model for charge exchange and ionization processes
usage_notes: Implements the Burrell model from K. Burrell, Journal of Computational Physics 27.1 (1978): 88-102
Calculates neutral density and particle sources from gas puff fueling
Assumes equal particle distribution among all hydrogenic species
Uses charge exchange and electron impact ionization rates
Particle confinement time is limited to maximum of 10 seconds

ActorFitProfiles.name: ActorFitProfiles

key_parameters.time_averaging: Time window for smoothing experimental data in seconds
key_parameters.time_basis_ids: Source for time basis (equilibrium or core_profiles)
key_parameters.rho_grid: Number of radial grid points for output profiles

ActorFitProfiles.description: Fits experimental diagnostic data (Thomson scattering, charge exchange, interferometer) to generate smooth plasma profiles
usage_notes: Performs outlier removal on raw diagnostic data
Scales Thomson scattering density to match interferometer measurements
Excludes divertor Thomson data (D3D specific implementation)
Enforces quasi-neutrality in the fitted profiles
Creates smooth profiles suitable for transport simulations

ActorCurrent.name: ActorCurrent
ActorCurrent.physics_domain: Plasma current evolution and ohmic heating

key_parameters.model: Switch between current evolution models: SteadyStateCurrent, QED, replay, or none

ActorCurrent.description: Provides a common interface to run multiple ohmic current evolution actors, solving for j_total in core profiles and updating related current quantities
usage_notes: The fundamental quantity being solved is j_total in dd.core_profiles.profiles_1d[]
Freezes j_bootstrap and j_non_inductive before updating j_ohmic
Updates bootstrap and ohmic parallel current and heating sources in core_sources
Supports multiple current evolution models selected via the model parameter

ActorSOL.name: ActorSOL
ActorSOL.physics_domain: Scrape-Off Layer (SOL) physics and plasma-wall interactions

key_parameters.model: Switch between SOL models - :box (box model), :replay (replay from data), or :none (no operation)

ActorSOL.description: Compound actor that provides a common interface to run different Scrape-Off Layer (SOL) models including box model, replay from data, or no operation
usage_notes: Acts as a wrapper/selector for different SOL modeling approaches
Only one sub-actor is instantiated based on the model parameter
Automatically calls step() and finalize() when instantiated with dd and act parameters

ActorSimpleIC.name: ActorSimpleIC
ActorSimpleIC.physics_domain: Ion cyclotron heating and current drive

key_parameters.rho_0: Desired radial location of the deposition profile
key_parameters.width: Desired width of the deposition profile
key_parameters.ηcd_scale: Scaling factor for nominal current drive efficiency

ActorSimpleIC.description: Estimates ion-cyclotron electron/ion energy deposition and current drive as a gaussian profile. Uses simplified current drive efficiency model from GASC.
usage_notes: Current drive efficiency based on G. Tonon 'Current Drive Efficiency Requirements for an Attractive Steady-State Reactor'
Assumes 80% power absorption by ions for FPP cases (minority heating)
Uses fast ion thermalization time for MeV range fast-ions
Generates gaussian deposition profiles for heating and current drive

ActorTroyonBetaNN.name: ActorTroyonBetaNN

key_parameters.verbose: Flag to control verbosity of output messages

ActorTroyonBetaNN.description: Evaluates low-n no-wall ideal MHD stability using neural network models to calculate Troyon beta limits
usage_notes: Actor is disabled for negative triangularity plasmas
Uses pre-trained neural network models from TroyonBetaNN package
Calculates Troyon beta limits for multiple toroidal mode numbers
Results are stored as toroidal modes with perturbation type 'Troyon no-wall'

ActorFluxMatcher.name: ActorFluxMatcher

key_parameters.scale_turbulence_law: Scale turbulent transport to target confinement law (:h98, :ds03)
key_parameters.Δt: Time step for evolution (Inf for steady state)

ActorFluxMatcher.description: Evaluates transport fluxes and source fluxes and minimizes the flux-match error to achieve steady-state or time-dependent plasma profiles
usage_notes: Performs iterative flux matching to find consistent plasma profiles
Supports various optimization algorithms including Broyden, Anderson, and trust region methods
Can evolve temperatures, densities, and rotation independently or together
Includes options for scaling turbulent transport to achieve target confinement
Handles quasi-neutrality enforcement when evolving densities
Supports replay mode to use profiles from reference plasma
Uses normalized rotation shear approach (TGYRO) for rotation evolution

ActorSOLBox.name: ActorSOLBox
ActorSOLBox.physics_domain: Scrape-off layer (SOL) physics and divertor heat exhaust

key_parameters.Ti_t: Input ion temperature at the target (eV)
key_parameters.frac_mom: Fraction of momentum lost due to collisions and viscous forces
key_parameters.Te_t: Input electron temperature at the target (eV)
key_parameters.frac_cond: Fraction of power carried by electron conduction

ActorSOLBox.description: 0D box model for the scrape-off layer that calculates upstream and target plasma conditions based on parallel heat and particle fluxes
usage_notes: Based on 0D SOL box model by X. Zhang et al. (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.nme.2022.101354)
Calculates upstream conditions from target conditions using parallel heat conduction
Automatically determines single vs double null configuration based on magnetic balance
If λq is not specified (Inf), uses twice the Eich scaling prediction
Only populates first point in edge_profiles radial grid (separatrix values)

ActorEPED.name: ActorEPED
ActorEPED.physics_domain: Pedestal physics and edge transport barrier modeling

key_parameters.ped_factor: Pedestal height multiplier (width scaled by sqrt)
key_parameters.rho_ped: Rho at which pedestal region starts
key_parameters.only_powerlaw: Use power-law fit without NN correction
key_parameters.rho_nml: Rho at which no man's land region starts

ActorEPED.description: Evaluates pedestal boundary conditions (height and width) using EPED-NN model for pedestal prediction
usage_notes: EPED-NN is only trained on m_effective = 2.0 & 2.5
Standard EPED uses 1/2 width as fraction of psi_norm
FUSE uses full width as function of rho_tor_norm
Pedestal density at rho=0.9 is converted to EPED pedestal density
EPED results are sensitive to triangularity values
Uses flux surface inside LCFS to avoid boundary sensitivity

ActorTEQUILA.name: ActorTEQUILA
ActorTEQUILA.physics_domain: MHD equilibrium and magnetic flux surfaces

key_parameters.relax: Relaxation on the Picard iterations (0.0 <= relax <= 1.0, default: 0.25)
key_parameters.free_boundary: Convert fixed boundary equilibrium to free boundary one (default: true)
key_parameters.number_of_fourier_modes: Number of modes for Fourier decomposition (default: 8)
key_parameters.number_of_radial_grid_points: Number of TEQUILA radial grid points (default: 31)
key_parameters.number_of_MXH_harmonics: Number of Fourier harmonics in MXH representation of flux surfaces (default: 4)
key_parameters.fixed_grid: Fix P and Jt on this rho grid (:poloidal or :toroidal, default: :toroidal)

ActorTEQUILA.description: Runs the fixed boundary equilibrium solver TEQUILA, computing MHD equilibrium from pressure and current profiles
usage_notes: TEQUILA is a fixed boundary equilibrium solver that can optionally convert to free boundary
Reuses flux surface information if boundary has not changed for efficiency
Automatically prevents current from changing sign relative to plasma current
Uses MXH (Miller eXtended Harmonic) parametrization for flux surfaces
Can work with either poloidal or toroidal flux coordinate grids

ActorEGGO.name: ActorEGGO
ActorEGGO.physics_domain: MHD equilibrium and magnetic field reconstruction

key_parameters.model: Neural network model to be used (default: d3d_efit01efit02cake02)
key_parameters.timeslice_average: Number of previous time slices to average with current solution for stability
key_parameters.use_vacuumfield_green: Use Vacuum Fields green's function tables for coil contributions
key_parameters.decimate_boundary: Parameter to decimate number of boundary points for computational efficiency
key_parameters.debug: Print debug information within EGGO solve

ActorEGGO.description: ML-based free boundary equilibrium solver using the EGGO neural network framework to compute plasma equilibrium from boundary shape and pressure/current profiles
usage_notes: EGGO uses machine learning to accelerate equilibrium reconstruction compared to traditional Grad-Shafranov solvers
The actor averages solutions with previous time slices for improved stability
Requires pre-trained neural network models and Green's function tables
Integrates with VacuumFields for external coil field calculations
Boundary points can be decimated to reduce computational cost

ActorSimpleLH.name: ActorSimpleLH

key_parameters.rho_0: Desired radial location of the deposition profile
key_parameters.width: Desired width of the deposition profile
key_parameters.ηcd_scale: Scaling factor for nominal current drive efficiency

ActorSimpleLH.description: Estimates Lower-hybrid electron energy deposition and current drive as a gaussian distribution based on simple parametric models
usage_notes: Current drive efficiency from GASC, based on G. Tonon 'Current Drive Efficiency Requirements for an Attractive Steady-State Reactor'
Uses simplified gaussian profile for power deposition
Automatically calculates current drive based on local plasma parameters

ActorTGLF.name: ActorTGLF
ActorTGLF.physics_domain: Turbulent transport modeling for tokamak plasmas

key_parameters.lump_ions: Combine fuel species (D,T) and impurities in calculations
key_parameters.electromagnetic: Toggle between electromagnetic or electrostatic calculations
key_parameters.model: Choice of transport model: TGLF, TGLFNN (neural network), GKNN, or TJLF
key_parameters.onnx_model: Use ONNX format for neural network models
key_parameters.tglfnn_model: Specific TGLF-NN model to use from available models
key_parameters.custom_input_files: Override default inputs with custom TGLF/TJLF input files
key_parameters.sat_rule: Saturation rule for TGLF calculations (sat0, sat0quench, sat1, sat1geo, sat2, sat3)
key_parameters.rho_transport: Normalized toroidal flux coordinate values for transport calculations

ActorTGLF.description: Evaluates turbulent transport fluxes using TGLF (Trapped Gyro-Landau Fluid) and related models including TGLFNN neural network surrogate, GKNN, and TJLF
usage_notes: Supports multiple transport models including original TGLF and neural network surrogates
TGLFNN provides faster evaluation using neural network approximations
Can save input files for debugging using save_input_tglfs_to_folder parameter
Supports uncertainty quantification when using Measurement types
Neural network models can warn when querying outside training bounds

ActorReplay.name: ActorReplay
ActorReplay.physics_domain: Data replay and simulation state reproduction

key_parameters.replay_dd: IMAS data dictionary containing the data to replay from
key_parameters.base_actor: Base actor that defines the specific replay behavior

ActorReplay.description: Actor for replaying past behavior from stored IMAS data, allowing re-execution of previously recorded simulation states
usage_notes: Requires implementation of _step and _finalize methods for specific replay behavior
Can wrap any base actor to provide replay functionality
Replay data source can be provided as Entry or directly as IMAS.dd
Actor behavior is defined by dispatch on _step and _finalize functions

ActorBalanceOfPlant.name: ActorBalanceOfPlant
ActorBalanceOfPlant.physics_domain: Power plant systems and electricity generation

key_parameters._name: Name identifier for the actor instance
key_parameters._time: Time coordinate for the balance of plant calculations

ActorBalanceOfPlant.description: Balance of plant actor that estimates the net electrical power output by comparing the balance of plant electrical needs with the electricity generated from the thermal cycle
usage_notes: Stores all output data in dd.balance_of_plant
Automatically calculates heat loads from breeder, divertor, and wall components
Breeder heat load is summed from all blanket modules' thermal power extraction
Divertor heat load is summed from all divertor incident power
Wall heat load is calculated from core radiation losses

ActorTORBEAM.name: ActorTORBEAM
ActorTORBEAM.physics_domain: Electron cyclotron heating and current drive
ActorTORBEAM.description: Actor that interfaces with the TORBEAM code for electron cyclotron (EC) wave propagation and absorption calculations in fusion plasmas
usage_notes: Requires TORBEAM package to be installed
Calls TORBEAM.run_torbeam to perform the EC wave propagation calculations
Inherits from SingleAbstractActor indicating it performs a single physics calculation

ActorRABBIT.name: ActorRABBIT
ActorRABBIT.physics_domain: Neutral beam injection and fast ion physics

key_parameters.Δt_history: Amount of history in seconds to include for time-dependent simulations
key_parameters.remove_inputs: Delete directory containing RABBIT input files after run (default: true)

ActorRABBIT.description: Actor that interfaces with the RABBIT code for neutral beam injection (NBI) physics calculations including beam deposition, current drive, and torque
usage_notes: Runs RABBIT code to calculate NBI deposition profiles including power deposition to electrons and ions
Calculates beam-driven current and torque deposition
Extends RABBIT output grid to edges to prevent extrapolation issues
Handles multiple NBI units and time-dependent power modulation
Requires equilibrium and core profiles data to be present
Outputs include fast ion source terms for transport modeling

ActorBlanket.name: ActorBlanket

key_parameters.blanket_multiplier: Neutron thermal power multiplier in blanket (default: 1.2)
key_parameters.minimum_first_wall_thickness: Minimum first wall thickness in meters (default: 0.02)
key_parameters.thermal_power_extraction_efficiency: Fraction of thermal power extracted by coolant (default: 1.0)

ActorBlanket.description: Evaluates blanket tritium breeding ratio (TBR), heat deposition, and neutron leakage for fusion reactor blankets
usage_notes: Requires blanket layers to be present in build structure
Optimizes layer thicknesses to achieve target TBR while minimizing neutron leakage
Handles multiple blanket modules with different geometries
Calculates effective thickness based on neutron flux direction
Uses NNeutronics package for TBR and leakage calculations
